tourBios.curYrHigh: Entered his rookie season with no prior PGA TOUR starts but jumped out of the gate with a T19 finish at the season-opening Frys.com Open. Sandwiched in between bookend 73s were rounds of 66-68 at Silverado leading to his only top-25 finish of the season. Ended the year No. 202 in the FedExCup standings.
tourBios.carHigh: 2009: Recorded his best Web.com Tour finish, a T25 at the Ford Wayne Gretzy Classic.
tourBios.personal: Lettered all fours year in high school in soccer…Made his first hole-in-one at Presidio Hills at age 10…If he weren't a golfer, would be a bass player in a band…Is a big Los Angeles Lakers fan…Never travels without music and headphones…Twitter account is @lowsizzlers…Not many people know he is half-Mexican.

tourBios.intlVics: (2) 2007 Jane Rogers Championship of Mississauga [Can], Corona Mazatlan Classic [Can].
tourBios.curYearHigh: Entered his rookie season with no prior PGA TOUR starts but jumped out of the gate with a T19 finish at the season-opening Frys.com Open. Sandwiched in between bookend 73s were rounds of 66-68 at Silverado leading to his only top-25 finish of the season. Ended the year No. 202 in the FedExCup standings.
tourBios.carHigh:
2013: Made the cut in nine of 24 starts during his first full Web.com Tour season and recorded six top-25 finishes. Finished solo second at the WNB Golf Classic in April. Moved into contention at Midland CC with a third-round 64, which got him within two strokes of 54-hole leader Edward Loar. Challenged for the lead on the final day but never got closer than one stroke. Was one down to clubhouse leader Alex Aragon with two holes to go and wound up making two pars to finish one shot back. Solid week moved him from No. 47 to No. 9 on the money list...Finished T8 at the Web.com Tour Championship after missing the cut in the first three Finals' events. 

2011: Won last PGA TOUR Canada event of the year, Desert Dunes Classic. Had four top-25s in eight starts.

2010: Had two top-10s in Canada in eight starts.

2009: Recorded his first Web.com Tour top-25 finish, a T25 at the Ford Wayne Gretzky Classic. On PGA TOUR Canada, won the Times Colonist Open and had two runner-up finishes in a five-tournament span in June and July. Made 12 appearances.

2008: Best finish in 11 PGA TOUR Canada events was a T2 at Vancouver Charity Classic. Had four top-six finishes overall.

2007: Won two PGA TOUR Canada events, the Jane Rogers Championship of Mississauga and the Corona Mazatlan Classic. Named that circuit's Player of the Year.
tourBios.personal: Four-year high school letterman in soccer...Made his first hole-in-one at Presidio Hills at age 10...Was a member of the Pepperdine golf team for his first two years of college but never played in a tournament and wound up leaving the team after his sophomore season...If he weren't a golfer, would be a bass player in a band. Played bass guitar with a band in his younger days...Is a big Los Angeles Lakers' fan...Never travels without music and headphones...Twitter account is @bsmithers31...Not many people know he is half-Mexican.

Sandwiched in between bookend 73s were rounds of 66-68 at Silverado leading to his only top-25 finish of the season. Ended the year No. 202 in the FedExCup standings.

tourBios.exmtStatus: 42nd on the 2014 Web.com Tour priority list

tourBios.curYearHigh: Entered his rookie season with no prior PGA TOUR starts but jumped out of the gate with a T19 finish at the season-opening Frys.com Open. Sandwiched in between bookend 73s were rounds of 66-68 at Silverado leading to his only top-25 finish of the season. Ended the year No. 202 in the FedExCup standings.
tourBios.carHigh:
2013-14: Finished the Web.com Tour season with 24 starts. Only missed playing in one tournament in a year that included a win, a T8 and six top-25s...After missing the cut in the season opener in Colombia, made the cut in his next five starts, which included three top-25 finishes...Earned his first career win in May, capturing The Rex Hospital Open. Was seven shots back at the halfway mark. Grabbed a share of the 54-hole lead at 11 under with an 8-under 63 at TPC Wakefield Plantation to tie Hunter Haas and Harold Varner III for the lead. Was the outright leader at the turn Sunday, thanks to birdies on Nos. 3, 4 and 6. Broke from the pack on the back nine, making four birdies in a five-hole stretch, starting at No. 11. Stepped to the 18th tee with a five-shot lead and closed with a conservative bogey-5 to win by four strokes. First-place check was worth $112,500 and vaulted him from No. 66 to No. 10 on the money list...Recorded another top-10 the next week, at the Cleveland Open. After a first-round 71, posted 69-66-68 to garner a T8...Officially secured his 2014-15 PGA TOUR card for the first time at the conclusion of the Regular Season in late-August (21st on the money list). Ended the Regular Season with nine finishes of T29 or better in 20 starts.

2013: Made the cut in nine of 24 starts during his first full Web.com Tour season and recorded six top-25 finishes. Finished solo second at the WNB Golf Classic in April. Moved into contention at Midland CC with a third-round 64, which got him within two strokes of 54-hole leader Edward Loar. Challenged for the lead on the final day but never got closer than one stroke. Was one down to clubhouse leader Alex Aragon with two holes to go and wound up making two pars to finish one shot back. Solid week moved him from No. 47 to No. 9 on the money list...Finished T8 at the Web.com Tour Championship after missing the cut in the first three Finals' events. 

2011: Won last PGA TOUR Canada event of the year, Desert Dunes Classic. Had four top-25s in eight starts.

2010: Had two top-10s in Canada in eight starts.

2009: Recorded his first Web.com Tour top-25 finish, a T25 at the Ford Wayne Gretzky Classic. On PGA TOUR Canada, won the Times Colonist Open and had two runner-up finishes in a five-tournament span in June and July. Made 12 appearances.

2008: Best finish in 11 PGA TOUR Canada events was a T2 at Vancouver Charity Classic. Had four top-six finishes overall.

2007: Won twice, setting a tournament record of 269 to win the Cornoa Mazatlan Mexican PGA Championship in April followed by a victory in August at the Jane Rogers Championship of Mississauga...Recorded five top-10 finishes, earned over $89,000 and won the Order of Merit title. 2009: Won this third Canadian Tour event at the Times Colonist Open with a final-round 64 for a 13-under-par 267.
tourBios.personal: Four-year high school letterman in soccer...Made his first hole-in-one at Presidio Hills at age 10...Was a member of the Pepperdine golf team for his first two years of college but never played in a tournament and wound up leaving the team after his sophomore season...If he weren't a golfer, would be a bass player in a band. Played bass guitar with a band in his younger days...Is a big Los Angeles Lakers' fan...Never travels without music and headphones...Twitter account is @bsmithers31...Not many people know he is half-Mexican.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was T19th in 2015 at the Frys.com Open.
